{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Almiel | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]], [[Sindarin]] and [[Quenya]] | birth={{SA|729}} | birthlocation=[[Forostar]] | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Tar-Meneldur]] and [[Almarian]] | siblings=[[Tar-Aldarion|Anardil]] and [[Ailinel]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Almiel''' ([[Quenya|Q]], pron. {{IPA|[ˈalmi.el]}}, stem ''Almield-'') was the third child and second daughter of [[Tar-Meneldur]] and [[Almarian]]. Her older brother was [[Tar-Aldarion|Anardil]], who when he became king was known as [[Tar-Aldarion]].{{UT|Kings}} When Aldarion built the great ship [[Palarran]] Tar-Meneldur was angry. Though Queen Almarian stayed the king from prohibiting Aldarion from sailing, the king did forbid his wife and daughters from bringing a bough of ''[[oiolairë]]'' to the ship. Because Almarian, Ailinel, and Almiel obeyed the king's command it gave [[Erendis]] the opportunity to present the token of goodwill to the prince, which kindled love in Aldarion for Erendis.{{UT|Wife}} ==Etymology== ''Almiel'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Blessed Daughter" and is a compound of ''[[alma|almë]]'' ("good (or blessed) thing", "blessing", "piece of good fortune") and ''[[-iel]]'' (feminine suffix, "-daughter").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2220848169.html|articlename=Q.
